poem:
Title: In the Halls of History

From Berlin's wall, fell history's sleep,
A decade cloaked in saturnine silence,
Swords to ploughs, relief reaped,
Yet cost of security hints violence.
Affluence graced, star-kissed peace,
Westward turns, yet finds no release,
A holiday, or history's deceit?
The truth lies beneath Starmer's feet.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
